noun.description: A sign or warning that something, especially something momentous or calamitous, is likely to happen.
examples: they believed that wild birds in the house were portents of death
JFK's political debut was a portent of the fame to come

noun.description: An exceptional or wonderful person or thing.
examples: what portent can be greater than a pious notary?

origin: Late 16th century: from Latin portentum omen, token, from the verb portendere (see portend).
